intro: Anchusa × digenea, commonly known as the hybrid blueweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Anchusa × digenea is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
